CUSBD_Ep_s Struct Reference
Dynamic Data Structures

#include <cusbd_structs_if.h>

Detailed Description

Structure represents device USB endpoint

Field Documentation

uint8_t CUSBD_Ep_s::address

Endpoint address, the oldest bit refers to endpoint direction. For example: address = 0x82 refers to endpoint 2 IN address = 0x03 refers to endpoint 3 OUT

const uint8_t* CUSBD_Ep_s::compDesc

pointer to user defined endpoint companion descriptor, useful only in SS mode, CH9_UsbSSEndpointCompanionDescriptor is defined in cusb_ch9_if.h

const uint8_t* CUSBD_Ep_s::desc

pointer to user defined endpoint descriptor, CH9_UsbEndpointDescriptor is defined in cusb_ch9_if.h

LIST_ListHead CUSBD_Ep_s::epList

enables organization of endpoints in linked list

CUSBD_EpPrivate* CUSBD_Ep_s::epPrivate

pointer to the private data of this endpoint

uint8_t CUSBD_Ep_s::maxburst

Maximal number of packets in burst transfer, useful only in SS mode. Maxburst value is in range from 0 to 15 giving number of packets 1 to 16. Refers to USB transfer burst.

uint16_t CUSBD_Ep_s::maxPacket

Maximal packet size for endpoint

uint16_t CUSBD_Ep_s::maxStreams

Maximal number of streams used by endpoint, useful only in SS mode

uint8_t CUSBD_Ep_s::mult

packet multiplication, it enables to multiplicate number of packet per service interval, useful in HS and SS mode only for isochronous endpoint, mult value range from 0 to 2 - it multiplicate packets by 1 to 3

char CUSBD_Ep_s::name[100]

keeps name of endpoint

const CUSBD_EpOps* CUSBD_Ep_s::ops

endpoint driver, contains methods for all operation required on endpoint
